content.text:
# 2019 President's Cup (tennis) – Women's singles__disambig_1

Marie Bouzková
| runner   =  Natalija Kostić
| score    = 6–3, 6–3
| before_name = President's Cup (tennis) – Women's singles
| after_name = President's Cup – Women's Singles
| after_year=2021
}}
Ekaterine Gorgodze was the defending champion, but chose to participate at the 2019 Bucharest Open instead.
Marie Bouzková won the title, defeating Natalija Kostić in the final, 6–3, 6–3.
Seeds
Marie Bouzková (champion)
#  Valeria Savinykh (withdrew)
#  Mariam Bolkvadze (semifinals, retired)
#  Sabina Sharipova (second round)
#  Wang Xinyu (quarterfinals)
#  Çağla Büyükakçay (quarterfinals)
#  Natalija Kostić (final)
#  Anastasia Gasanova (first round)
}}
